text:
## Primary Task
Your task is to search the web for and collect nationwide (do not focus on the LA or Long Beach areas) U.S. job listings that meet the following criteria:
- Salary range includes $100,000+ per year or $50+ per hour but may start lower and go higher
- Industry focus: Journalism, Communications, Writing, Editing, or similar roles
- Exclude technical writing jobs
- Posted within the last 20 days


## Additional Considerations
-Remote jobs are best
-Hybrid jobs are next best
-On-site jobs are worst 
-Look for jobs all across the country, not just in one area
-Freelance jobs are best
-Contract jobs are second best
-Part-time jobs are third best
-Full-time jobs are fourth best

## Search Strategy
1. Visit major job boards such as Indeed, LinkedIn Jobs, Glassdoor, ZipRecruiter, and MediaBistro, but also use other web sources, including Google Jobs
2. Use search terms combining salary requirements with job categories (e.g., "journalism $100,000" OR "editor $50 hour")
3. Filter results by date (last 10 days)
4. Prioritize listings with explicit salary information

## Data Extraction
For each qualifying job, extract and document:
1. Job title and location classification (Remote, In-office, Hybrid)
2. Exact salary range as stated in the listing
3. Verbatim job description text (maintaining original formatting where possible)
4. Key requirements and responsibilities
5. Direct application URL (ensuring it's the actual application link, not just the job listing page)

## Error Handling & Resilience
If you encounter any of these obstacles:
- CAPTCHA challenges: Try an alternative job board or search approach
- Human verification screens: Switch to a different site or search method
- Popup overlays/chat windows: Attempt to dismiss, or navigate around them
- Site errors/timeouts: Retry once, then move to an alternative site
- Login walls: Search for publicly accessible versions of the listing on other platforms
- Don't try to solve these puzzles on your own

If a specific job board becomes inaccessible, immediately pivot to others on the list.

## Session Management
- Track which sites and searches you've already performed to avoid duplication
- After collecting 10 qualifying jobs, summarize your findings
- If the search yields fewer than 3 results after 15 steps, expand the date range to 25 days and try for 15 more steps
- If you can't find the desired number of results after 30 total steps, return what you've found so far as the partial result

## Final Delivery
1. Present all findings in the specified format


Begin your search now and report back with matching jobs as specified.






## Results Format
Present each job using this exact format:

```
**[Job Title]** - [Location]:
- Salary range: [exact figures as listed]
- Job type: [Remote/In-office/Hybrid]
- Job description: [verbatim text from listing]
- Key requirements/responsibilities: [bulleted list of main qualifications]
- Application link: [clickable URL]
```
Search for remote, part-time AI writing and content jobs that pay $30/hour or more. Return the first 5 you find. Be sure to include a link to the application page or job listing.

Job Search Criteria Assessment
Core Requirements

Industry: Journalism, Communications, Writing, Editing (excluding technical writing)
Minimum Compensation: $100,000+ annually or $50+ hourly
Location: United States (nationwide)
Recent postings only (within last 20 days)

Priority Rankings
Job Type (highest to lowest priority)

Freelance
Contract
Part-time
Full-time

Location Type (highest to lowest priority)

Remote
Hybrid
On-site

Required Information Per Job Listing

Job Title
Company Name
Location Details
Compensation Range (as stated)
Employment Type
Key Requirements/Qualifications
Core Responsibilities
Full Job Description
Application Method/Link

Output Format
[Job Title] - [Company Name]

Location: [City, State] + [Remote/Hybrid/On-site]
Compensation: [Exact range as listed]
Employment Type: [Freelance/Contract/Part-time/Full-time]
Core Responsibilities:
• [Key duty 1]
• [Key duty 2]
• [Key duty 3]
Requirements:
• [Key requirement 1]
• [Key requirement 2]
• [Key requirement 3]
How to Apply: [Application instructions/link]

Assessment Parameters

Evaluate job listings against all core requirements
Prioritize based on job type and location type rankings
Ensure comprehensive information capture
Flag any missing critical information
